basics.name: Chad Kruse
basics.label: Product Engineer
basics.summary: A Full Stack Developer with a unique ability to bridge the gap between strategy, product, and development. As a Product Engineer, I leverage my skills to extract, interpret, and utilize consumer insights to build category-defining products. Empathy is a core personality trait of mine, not just a skill. Intensely curious.

work.summary: My first job out of undergrad. Also the place I got my de-facto MBA thanks to the active and engaged mentoring I received from the firm's partners. Amazing experience working with these nationally-recognized business valuation experts.
highlights: Assessed future prospects of clients through extensive market research and heavy financial modeling.
Performed business valuations and other investment banking related services.
Trained new analysts on research strategies and financial modeling.

work.position: Senior Associate - Acquisitions and Strategic Ventures
work.summary: Part of a three-member team responsible for all corporate VC and technology commercialization deals for Science Applications International Corporation, a Fortune 500 company.
highlights: Sourced, analyzed, and executed venture capital investments and growth-oriented mergers and acquisitions to expand the company's reach into commercial markets.
Placed $90M of early to mezzanine stage venture capital in 15 months (11 transactions).
Built and evangelized a new valuation model subsequently adopted across all 600+ business units.

work.position: Senior Manager - Corporate & New Market Development
work.summary: Served as one of four dealmakers and corporate strategists for Intuit, the Fortune 500 consumer and SMB-focused technology company.
highlights: Successfully led the company's first partnership with Paypal, generating $100M of value creation.
Recognized for driving cross-functional teams and closing dynamic deals efficiently and effectively, earning praise from the CEO.
Proactively identified growth opportunities, prioritized them, and led internal collaboration, planning, and execution.

work.summary: Traveled the world and launched Saava.org, a localized, online angel investing network focused on mission-related opportunities (e.g. nonprofits developing for-profit income streams). Ultimately grew the network to 35 accredited investor members, presenting over 60 deals to the community.
highlights: Venture Philanthropy
World Travel

work.summary: First non-partner hire for Riverlake Partners, a lower middle-market private equity fund. Assisted partners in all aspects of the fund, from modeling to negotiations and portfolio management activities.
highlights: Responsible for deal flow program including sourcing, vetting, assessing, and modeling potential deals. Lead due diligence and deal closing activities.
Raised debt capital in support of acquisitions, collaborated with funding partners and industry colleagues, and worked extensively with outside attorneys to close transactions.
Assisted in ongoing portfolio-level improvement activities including the development of add-on acquisition strategies, financing expansion plans, and other ad-hoc projects.

work.summary: Partnered with domain experts and technical founders to focus, launch, or expand. As a COO-for-hire, my roles ranged from business development and API evangelism to fundraising, product, and corporate strategy.
highlights: Served as product lead and COO for Forkfly, managing the launch of three web applications and two mobile platforms. Transitioned the company from single app to digital advertising platform, tripling the team from 4 to 12 and bringing the company to first revenues.
Crafted and evangelized the platform strategy for innovative sensor startup GreenGoose resulting in a successful seven-figure fundraise.
Full interactive list of companies and projects available at www.chadkruse.com.

work.summary: Helped bring the idea of refurbished wind turbines to life.
highlights: Developed core financial model to assess project ROI
Assisted the management team with negotiation strategy resulting in their first disassembly deal.
Identified risks and developed mitigation strategies

work.summary: In partnership with one of the most passionate domain experts I have met to date, I played a leadership role with the creation and eventual market launch of WiLD Forests I, L.P., a conservation-based timberland investment management fund.
highlights: Brought focus to the company's historical activities, allowing for drastically improved upside with far less overhead.
Identified and hired nationally-recognized legal counsel to develop the fund's Confidential Information Memorandum.
Lead all corporate development, finance, and fundraising activities, from assessing project ROI to pitching institutional investment partners.

work.summary: One of the first startups involved in social e-commerce, I consulted with Bonanza (formerly Bonanzle) during its bootstrap phase, serving as its first business hire.
highlights: Initiated first partnership discussions with major technology companies including Microsoft, Google, and Amazon
Assessed new vertical growth opportunities through customer interviews and data mining.
Lead early API evangelism efforts and managed the company's first ad campaign.

work.summary: Forkfly (now CloudEngage) was an early entrant in the highly competitive location-based mobile space, and as COO I had the honor of serving as product lead, building a rockstar development team from the ground up, and leading overall strategy development.
highlights: Lead the company through a major pivot, transitioning from a single app to digital advertising platform.
Served as product lead through the launch of three web applications and two mobile platforms.
Solely funded by angels, I brought the company to first revenues, growing the team from 4 to 12.

work.summary: Served as COO for innovative wireless sensor startup GreenGoose during a critical time in the company's history, partnering with the solo founder after a successful seed round but still during the prototype phase.
highlights: Assessed, discussed, and synthesized the myriad opportunities into a clear execution strategy.
Worked with contract developers to launch production mobile apps in support of platform strategy.
Lead discussions with inbound Fortune 500 biz dev inquiries, and set groundwork for API evangelism.
Fielded all investor inquiries, eventually leading and closing a successful bridge round.

work.summary: My first incubated startup, we picked apart the core assumptions behind current time, calendaring, and scheduling tools piece by piece and set out to rebuild them from the ground up.
highlights: Took first commercial product from idea and no team to a public launch in just three months.
Recruited A-list alpha customers including many prominent VCs.
Responsible for overall product strategy, UI/UX, and the bulk of front-end development.

work.summary: Weekend technical support role allowed me to focus on Grantmakers.io nearly full-time.
highlights: Repaired customer relationships through one-on-one interactions with users.
Required immense empathy and the ability to quickly troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.
Consistently one of the top performers in customer satisfaction and technical accuracy.

work.summary: Conceptualized, created, and launched SmarterGiving, a prototype studio focused on market opportunities across the "charity stack".
highlights: Architected and developed robust data pipelines using bash, Node.js, AWS S3 SDK, and Google Cloud Platform.
Leveraged and explored various machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP) APIs to bring advanced classification algorithms in-house.
Drove multiple products from concept to launch using agile and lean startup principles.

work.summary: Grantmakers.io has grown into one of the largest free sources of searchable philanthropic data on the Internet. Built for purpose, not profit, the site makes a large, public IRS dataset useful to nonprofits.
highlights: Successfully brought project to market as the sole founder and developer, utilizing lean-startup principles from ideation to ongoing maintenance.
Utilized modern web development technologies, including JAMstack and serverless, to achieve unexpected time to market and earn recognition from world-renowned foundations and experts.
Optimized user experience through extensive use of Algolia search API, incorporating customer feedback and A/B testing.

work.position: Full Stack Developer - Global Digital Innovation
work.summary: Part of a small, agile team responsible for digital innovation opportunities across Kimberly-Clark, the Fortune 150 company best known for its global consumer brands including Huggies and Kleenex.
highlights: Built prototypes showcasing the art of the possible.
Collaborated with diverse, global teams to translate ideas into reality.
Developed the company's first internal large language model (LLM)-based chatbot as a proof of concept (POC), inspiring innovation within business teams globally.
Championed the Voice of the Customer (VoC) perspective in innovation engineering efforts, contributing to a 6x boost in conversions for a React/Typescript/Tailwind-based project.

work.summary: I took a sabbatical from a full-time software engineering role to modernize Grantmakers.io, a popular philanthropic endeavor I founded 7 years ago.
highlights: Transitioned from a static Jekyll site developed with vanilla JavaScript, to a dynamic, modern web application using Typescript and Svelte.
Designed an event-driven architecture for the ETL pipeline and refactored legacy components, using Node.js, Bash, and Typescript.

Applied my product experience to convert user feedback and analytics into innovative 0-1 features, experimenting with new AI APIs, services, and LLM platforms to develop promising proofs of concept (POCs).
